meanings.definition: To remove spiritual qualities or significance from something.
meanings.sent1: She was despiritualizing the ancient ritual by turning it into a mere tradition.
meanings.sent2: The modernization of the temple risked despiritualizing the sacred space.
meanings.sent3: By adding neon lights to the meditation room, he was despiritualizing it unintentionally.
meanings.sent4: The commercialization of spirituality was despiritualizing the essence of the practice.
meanings.sent5: The act of despiritualizing the ceremony drained it of its soulful essence.

meanings.definition: To make something less spiritual in nature.
meanings.sent1: The new rules were despiritualizing the spiritual retreat, making it feel more like a boot camp.
meanings.sent2: The constant noise pollution was slowly despiritualizing the peaceful atmosphere of the monastery.
meanings.sent3: His obsession with material possessions was despiritualizing his once pure intentions.
meanings.sent4: The industrialization of the sacred land was despiritualizing the connection to nature.
meanings.sent5: The negative energy in the room was despiritualizing the positive vibes of the group meditation.
